attributes.comment:
I am writing to oppose the raise in the fees indicated in document USCIS-2006-
0044. The documents indicated are related to international adoption, an already
lengthy and expensive undertaking. An increase in these already expensive fees
could potentialy creat an even greater hardship for those who desire to adopt a
child from overseas. Since the time frame from application to actual adoption of
the child is currently longer than the expiration on most of these documents,
amny fees already have to be paid twice by adoptive parents. When adopting our
daughter from China we had to pay several fees twice because the documents
expired prior to travel.It is already infuriating enough that the fingerprint time frame
expires and the whole process needs to be completed a second time in many
cases instead of a more cost effective extension of the time frame.
Please reconsider raising these fees.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Dawn A. Roberts
